item.description:
<i>Should Non-Liberals be Allowed to Study Bible in Public?</i>
Rabbi, I just read the two blog posts. This is not at all the question Dr. Lesses is asking. She is, rather, expressing misgivings about what appears to be a hijacking of the SBL by fundamentalist/literalist Christians, and what she (in my opinion, rightly) fears would be the inevitable degradation of scholarship.
item.content:encoded:
Should Non-Liberals be Allowed to Study Bible in Public?

Rabbi, I just read the two blog posts. This is not at all the question Dr. Lesses is asking. She is, rather, expressing misgivings about what appears to be a hijacking of the SBL by fundamentalist/literalist Christians, and what she (in my opinion, rightly) fears would be the inevitable degradation of scholarship.
